episodes.title: Captain Bill, the craziest Scientologist?
episodes.description: Jon reminisces with Sam about the craziest Scientologist he ever knew:  legendary Captain Bill Robertson, founder and architect of “Ron’s Org”  and the independent Scientology Freezone. Jon reads extracts from  Captain Bill’s Sector Operations Bulletins – which Bill claimed to have  received telepathically from Ron Hubbard – aboard the “Mothership” – In  1982.    Crown Hotel Meeting, Oct 18, 1983 https://youtu.be/tvfioivtY6c  Sector 9 book: http://galac-patra.org/sector9.html   For Scientology membership numbers: https://medium.com/how-many-scientologists-are-there-really)    Peter Forde's analysis of OT III: https://www.spaink.net/cos/essays/forde_volcanos.html

episodes.title: New Kadampa Tradition - a talk with Michelle Haslam
episodes.description: jon is joined by special guest Dr. Michelle Haslam; they discuss her  time in the authoritarian group known as "new kadampa tradition", her  background in psychology, and how and why people are drawn into  destructive groups.  links discussed in the video: the research of Miriam Anders on the cultic misuse of Buddhist  teachings: https://www.mdpi.com/2077-1444/10/11/622/htm   The Pema Chödrön Foundation: https://pemachodronfoundation.org  the findings of the Australian Royal Commission on Institutional  Responses to Child Sexual Abuse:  https://www.childabuseroyalcommission.gov.au   Michelle's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDz-Wk0ykecFBgB7Pg31cVQ/videos   and for help getting out of/surviving the NKT and other similar groups,  Michelle's website is here: https://newkadampatraditionreport.org   jon's paper, the Total Freedom Trap:  https://www.cs.cmu.edu/~dst/Fishman/atack-freedom-trap.html   Sir Ken Robinson's work: http://sirkenrobinson.com

episodes.title: parental alienation and prevention with Nick Child
episodes.description: What happens when after separating, one parent turns the children  against the other? Retired psychiatrist Nick Child talks to Jon about  the dire failure of the court system, and how to focus on the needs of  the children.   links:   Nick’s blog: https://thealienationexperience.org.uk  Blink, Think, Choice Voice: https://youtu.be/RdKPIK71SP8 (and Spike’s song based on it): https://youtu.be/La2NnQVwJXE  Socrates for six-year-olds (poor quality): https://youtu.be/vyD0l9En6Io  the Brainwashing of my Dad: https://www.thebrainwashingofmydad.com/  Institute for propaganda analysis: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Institute_for_Propaganda_Analysis

episodes.title: truth and certainty with Mike Rinder
episodes.description: Mike Rinder joins Jon again to answer some viewer questions and address  L. Ron Hubbard's problematic relationship to the truth. They also  discuss how the feeling of certainty keeps the members of many  destructive authoritarian groups from asking questions, considering that  the leader might be wrong, or even leaving the group.   links:  to Jon's paper "the possible origins for Dianetics and Scientology":  http://home.snafu.de/tilman/j/origins6.html?fbclid=IwAR3-V34IOIp8GcbWyOk_jdRtuMEV2S4NiA_m-igR0O17DNAvn7A79uK8IdQ#F63   and the accompanying video: https://youtu.be/VGQXQaiLa2A

episodes.title: possible origins of Dianetics and Scientology, part one
episodes.description: Does Scientology have origins in Sex Magick and Psychoanalysis? Is Ron  Hubbard’s claim to have been the only “source” of Dianetics and  Scientology true? Jon examines Hubbard’s many borrowings from other  authors and shows that Hubbard was aware of many of these sources.   This is the third in a series of recordings of Jon's papers on  Scientology, all of which are available to read free here:  https://www.facebook.com/notes/jon-atack/jons-writings-books-speeches/284316635347772/   To see the other two recordings of Jon reading his papers, see our  playlist here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOprfY0DnRsb0GBFQzrqmpMmNLRL6vmYi   To see Jon's talk on the history of Hubbard and the origins of  Scientology: https://youtu.be/2ILs6yB-d6A   Buy your copy of Jon's Tao Te Ching here:  https://www.amazon.com/Tao-Te-Ching-Lao-Tzu-ebook/dp/B072JL13DR/   And Let's Sell These People a Piece of Blue Sky here:  https://www.amazon.com/Lets-sell-these-people-Piece-ebook/dp/B00BF385HG/  (now FREE with Kindle Unlimited!)   For Jeff Jacobsen's work on Hubbard:  http://www.xenu.net/archive/lrhbare/ his other writings: http://jeffjacobsen.org/writings.htm and his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/cultxpt  please also see  Caroline Letkeman’s excellent work on the origins of  Scientology: http://www.carolineletkeman.org/propaganda/papers.html

episodes.title: possible origins of Dianetics and Scientology, part two
episodes.description: the second part of Jon's paper about Ron Hubbard's plagiarism. Hubbard  was not the 'sole source' of Dianetics and Scientology, nor did all of  the 'major' ideas come from him. With a comparison of Tibetan ideas  popularized by Alexandra David-Neel in the 1930s to some of the  fundamental ideas of Scientology.  With many thanks to Mark Owen Plummer, for help in finding the right  covers to the correct editions.   This is the second of two parts; here is part one:  https://youtu.be/VGQXQaiLa2A   This is the fourth in a series of recordings of Jon's papers on  Scientology, all of which are available to read free here:  https://www.facebook.com/notes/jon-atack/jons-writings-books-speeches/284316635347772/   To see the previous videos of Jon reading his papers, see our playlist  here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOprfY0DnRsb0GBFQzrqmpMmNLRL6vmYi   To see Jon's talk on the history of Hubbard and the origins of  Scientology: https://youtu.be/2ILs6yB-d6A

episodes.title: manipulation by gaslighting - a talk with Spike Robinson
episodes.description: gaslighting is the “royal road” to exerting control – but can you spot  it? Spike joins Jon to talk about gaslighting and the major techniques  predators use to confuse and paralyze people into compliance.   links:  the Levenson empathy index: https://openpsychometrics.org/tests/LSRP.php     Australian Royal Commission final report:  https://www.childabuseroyalcommission.gov.au/final-report   Gaslighting:  the play:  https://www.amazon.com/Gaslight-Frenchs-Acting-Patrick-Hamilton/dp/0573115796/     rent the 1940 movie:  https://www.amazon.com/Gaslight-Anton-Walbrook/dp/B002R1Q1ZS/    or watch free on YouTube:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UYmtzaHwCKo&t=8s    the DVD of the 1944 movie:  https://www.amazon.com/Gaslight-Charles-Boyer/dp/B07N4CL3HD/   and take our fun gaslighting quiz here: shorturl.at/glnN2

episodes.title: how Scientology harassment works - with Mike Rinder
episodes.description: Mike Rinder was head of Scientology’s sophisticated harassment  department for 20 years. In this stunning interview he describes the  fanatical determination to utterly ruin anyone who questions Hubbard's  work as a 'Supppressive Person', an 'enemy' of humanity. That included  Jon, when they last spoke in the mid-90s. Mike shows the secret Hubbard  documents that direct the harassment of 'Suppressives' and describes in  chilling detail the activities of the Office of Special Affairs which is  now trying to silence him with a typical smear campaign. In the 80s and  90s there were only a handful of persistent critics, but now thousands  are speaking out, so Scientology no longer has the resources to harass  any but its most vocal critics. These include Mike Rinder who has become  Scientology's most dangerous former insider.    We urge you to join the #IGotOut campaign!    for Chris Owens' research and papers on Scientology: http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~dst/Cowen/  for Jon's paper, "Scientology: religion or intelligence agency?": http://home.snafu.de/tilman/j/berlin.html?fbclid=IwAR3G8FA_m_jpw1sqwJLRTPtqlT8vTONCYInPmOlZ5yDPQVsNQeY8aNRAMto   Mike Rinder's blogpost on Scientology's harassment procedures: https://www.mikerindersblog.org/dealing-with-critics-of-scientology-the-l-ron-hubbard-playbook/   for the documentary, "the Shrinking World of L. Ron Hubbard": https://youtu.be/L_w-YWwC1lI   for all the current news on Scientology, check out Tony Ortega's Underground Bunker: https://tonyortega.org   for Chris Shelton's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF326xyA0QHI7Z5xAwKQDJg

episodes.title: the Kazan seminar on cults with Professor Alexander Dvorikin

episodes.title: moving beyond the guru - with Joe Kelly
episodes.description: Joe Kelly spent nine years in Transcendental Meditation and then five  more with a rival swami, who convinced his former TM followers to sue  for refunds from that group. This led to Joe meeting Margaret Singer,  who helped to begin to rethink his involvement. For many years, Joe has  worked helping members of authoritarian groups to rethink their  involvement.   note: the former Cult Awareness Network was shut down as a result of a  Scientology lawsuit, and then sold to that group as part of the  resulting settlement. Today those who contact CAN via its website or  phone number are connected to a Scientology front group. For more  information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Cult_Awareness_Network    links:  to the documentary ‘Captive Minds’: https://youtu.be/9UEfsSauTf4 the full story of the song ‘Sexy Sadie’: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexy_Sadie

episodes.title: Star Wars, cults and Campbell’s “hero’s journey”
episodes.description:
Joe Szimhart and Jon talk about Joseph Campbell’s Hero’s Journey and its influence on cult beliefs. Campbell said the worlds’ mythologies are not history but psychology. He placed the sacred at the center of intimate relationships, and talked about chivalry, the Grail legends and the lessons we can learn from myths. Campbell believed that creativity is the externalization of spirituality. Joe and Jon talk about Gnosticism, Hermes Trismegistus, the I Am movement and many other belief systems from the Eleusinian Mysteries in ancient Greece to Scientology and the Freemasons.

Read Jon's thoughts on Campbell's work here: http://jonatack.com/writings/mythsticks/campbell_flight.php

Check out Joe's work here: http://jszimhart.com

episodes.title: fake news and propaganda
episodes.description:
From corporate advertising to political and religious organizations, groups of every type use the same tricks to manipulate our attention and loyalty, and to plunder our cash. Long ago, an institute in the US was closed down after it revealed the secrets of  propaganda and fake news.

Read about the Institute for Propaganda Analysis here: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Institute_for_Propaganda_Analysis 

see more about Spike’s OT III window here: https://phoenyxrose.wordpress.com/2016/08/19/the-xenu-window-and-a-plea-for-help/

Little Baby’s Ice Cream commercials:
This is a Special Time: https://youtu.be/erh2ngRZxs0 
Love Lickers: https://youtu.be/j0_fVzTJO-8 

Budweiser commercial with baby Clydesdale: https://youtu.be/u9U60reTfDw

College Humor “if the other party wins”: https://youtu.be/y-_JhRJ0tWA

See more of Sam’s paper sculptures here: http://35.193.236.42/?page_id=6

And see active footage of the flannel moth caterpillar here: https://youtu.be/XBoAwg29CgI 

the “ABCs of Propaganda”:
• Ascertain the conflict element in the propaganda.
• Behold your own reaction.
• Concern yourself with today's propaganda associated with today's conflicts.
• Doubt that your opinions are "your very own".
• Evaluate, with the greatest care your own propaganda.
• Find the facts before you come to any conclusion.

tools of fake news: 
Impersonation of valid source
Emotion
Polarization
Attack large organizations
Conspiracies
Discredit detractors
Trolling

episodes.title: what does it mean to be British?
episodes.description:
Rio was born and grew up in England, and he’s lived here for all 18 years of his life, but, because his mum is Japanese, people often treat him as an immigrant. Jon and Rio consider ideas of ‘nation’, ‘racial purity’ and ‘racial supremacy’. As they point out, Hitler decided that the Japanese are Aryan, where most of the US’s White Nationalists would have been considered inferior by the Fuhrer.

episodes.title: selfishness or narcissism?
episodes.description:
Maybe the whole notion of narcissism is wrong. After all, Narcissus loved himself so much he drowned diving into his own image, but the people we call narcissists love themselves so little that they demand adulation. Expert Craig Malkin has drawn a spectrum of narcissism and speaks about ‘healthy narcissism’, and he defines narcissism as ‘feeling special’, but narcissists don’t feel special. Jon thinks it’s a spectrum of self-regard – too much, too little, or just enough.

episodes.title: self-similarity – a talk with Yuval Laor, PhD
episodes.description:
Yuval talks with Sam and Jon about the theory of self-similarity – where the parts are like smaller versions of the whole (as in fractal progressions). Yuval shows that although Erich Fromm’s Sane Society contains many useful ideas, the notion that individual ‘sanity’ can be used as a measure of social ‘sanity’ is outdated. Plato proposed that the ideal city would be an expanded version of the ideal self... Biologists followed a similar route, believing that the route from zygote to baby follows the steps of evolution, but life is not quite that simple!

episodes.title: Fromm on authoritarianism – a talk with Chris Shelton
episodes.description:
Chris Shelton quizzes Jon about Erich Fromm’s views on authoritarianism, freedom, narcissism, and the development of an independent self as the aim of life. Erich Fromm escaped Germany in 1933 when Hitler took power. He was a social psychologist and counsellor who wrote a series of best-selling books. Chris and Jon discuss this passage from Fromm’s "Man For Himself":

The duty of recognizing the authority’s superiority results in several prohibitions. The most comprehensive of these is the tabu against feeling oneself to be, or ever able to become, like the authority, for this would contradict the latter’s unqualified superiority and uniqueness. The real sin of Adam and Eve is, as has been pointed out before, the attempt to become like 
God; and it is as punishment for this challenge and simultaneously as a deterrence of a repetition of it that they are expelled from the Garden of Eden. In authoritarian systems the authority is made out to be fundamentally different from his subjects. He has powers not attainable by anyone else: magic, wisdom, strength which can never by matched by his subjects. Whatever the authority’s prerogatives are, whether he is the master of the universe or a unique leader sent by fate, the fundamental inequality between him and man is the basic tenet of authoritarian conscience. One particularly important aspect of the uniqueness of the authority is the privilege of being the only one who does not follow another’s will, but who himself wills; who is not a means but an end in himself; who creates and is not created. In the authoritarian orientation, the power of will and creation are the privilege of the authority. Those subject to him are means to his end, and, consequently, his property and used by him for his own purposes. The supremacy of the authority is questioned by the attempt of the creature to cease being a *thing* and to become a creator.

------------------------------------------

Christian and Jon talk about the range of contempt for others brought about by membership of extremist authoritarian sects.

episodes.title: loyalty - #copsintegritymatters
episodes.description:
We wholeheartedly support the nonviolent #blacklivesmatter movement and want to add that cops’ integrity also matters. In the present climate of racial tension, bigotry and ingrained injustice, we need to address the tribalism, misplaced loyalty, and persecution of whistleblowers in the law enforcement system. We should reward the good, name and shame the bad, and move forward into a more equitable state of justice for all.
 
In that spirit, we suggest the hashtag #copsintegritymatters - to encourage people to hold the police of all countries to account, and create a world where the justice system works for the people, and not against us. We also advocate more public acknowledgement of the difficult and challenging work that many police officers do, and suggest that good police departments show the bad ones how to support the law rather than their law-breaking associates.

episodes.title: the birth of the blues
episodes.description:

Robert Johnson’s Traveling Riverside Blues is the origin of Led Zeppelin’s ‘squeeze my lemon’ and Cream also recorded Four Until Late. The other founder of electric blues is the great T-Bone Walker.

episodes.title: "Demonic Cummings" the scandal and Sam’s paper sculpture
episodes.description:
Dominic Cummings is UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s senior aide. Here we see Sam’s sculptures of Cummings as a fish reeling in Johnson as a chicken. Cummings directed the campaign to leave the European Union with the slogan ‘Take Back Control’ and the false promise that departure would mean £350 million a week for the National Health Service. Although a member of the committee that ordered lockdown in the UK, Cummings ignored the Prime Minister’s order ‘Everyone must stay at home’ and, while he had COVID-19 drove 260 miles with his wife and infant child in the car. Many call the defiance of lockdown by crowds of UK citizens was the ‘Cummings Effect’.

episodes.title: Erich Fromm and the art of loving
episodes.description:
‘mature love is union under the condition of preserving one’s integrity, one’s individuality. Love is an active power in man; a power which breaks through the walls which separate man from his fellow men, which unites him with others; love makes him overcome the sense of isolation and separateness, yet it permits him to be himself, to retain his integrity. In love the paradox occurs that two beings become one and yet remain two.’ 

Jon and Sam discuss this and a few more choice passages of this classic work, and manage to include a fascinating tangential discussion about the decriminalization of cannabis for medical research.
Sam picked the Erich Fromm quotes.
--------------
‘The Canadian parliament had criminalized cannabis … following the publication of The Black Candle … [that] spewed out venom about the “dregs of humanity” … all marijuana users are “non-white and non-Christian, wanting only to seduce white women.” [the author] warned of “an international conspiracy of yellow and black drug pushers” whose ultimate goal is “the domination of the bright proud races of the world.” [Marijuana] has the effect of driving them completely insane. The addict loses all sense of moral responsibility. Addicts to this drug, while under its influence, are immune to pain, become raving maniacs, and are liable to kill or indulge in any form of violence…” … Canadian lawmakers … banned marijuana without any debate or scientific evidence … Lengthy jail sentences – up to seven years for possession and life in prison for trafficking – were meted out…’ Martin A Lee, Smoke Signals, Scribner, 2012
----------------------------

episodes.title: Martin Luther King's Dream
episodes.description:
a response to the killing of George Floyd and a plea for harmony.

I read the news today,
I can't stay silent, and I have to say
that this injustice must stop now,
and none can be truly free until we all are free, every one.
Yes, free to live and love and learn
and worship as we choose (or not)
for everyone an equal chance
to live the best life that they can.
And each one judged according to
the content of their character,
As Martin Luther King said many years ago.
No one deserves to be brutalized,
oppressed and prone to murder at the hands of those sworn to protect them.
This madness must stop now 
and we must stand together and be heard.
Let's keep King's dream alive,
remember to be kind,
give help where it is needed,
and comfort those in pain.
Let's speak of love, not fear,
and learn to conquer hate,
and cherish every person as a precious member of the human family.

episodes.title: recovery from Scientology and other authoritarian cults - part three
episodes.description:
In this final installment of a three-part series on recovery, Jon is joined by our friend Chris Shelton, to talk about the stages of recovery from Scientology, destructive cults, or any authoritarian, abusive group or relationship.

Here is the list Jon and Chris are working from:

1. A history of subjection to totalitarian control over a prolonged period (months to years). Examples include hostages, prisoners of war, concentration camp survivors, and survivors of some religious cults. [Authors’ note: We would remove the word 'religious' so as to include all systems of thought reform.] Examples also include those subjected to totalitarian systems in sexual and domestic life, including survivors of domestic battering, childhood physical or sexual abuse, and organized sexual exploitation.
 
2. Alterations in affect regulation, including
·      persistent dysphoria
·      chronic suicidal preoccupation
·      self-injury
·      explosive or extremely inhibited anger (may alternate)
·      compulsive or extremely inhibited sexuality (may alternate)
 
3. Alterations in consciousness, including
·      amnesia or hypermnesia for traumatic events
·      transient dissociative episodes
·      depersonalization/derealization
·      reliving experiences, either in the form of intrusive post-traumatic stress disorder symptoms or in the form of ruminative preoccupation
 
4. Alteration in self-perception, including
·      sense of helplessness or paralysis of initiative
·      shame, guilt, and self-blame
·      sense of defilement or stigma
·      sense of complete difference from others (may include a sense of specialness, utter aloneness, belief no other person can understand, or nonhuman identity)
 
5. Alterations in perception of perpetrator, including
·      preoccupation with relationship with perpetrator (includes preoccupation with revenge)
·      unrealistic attribution of total power to perpetrator (caution: victim’s assessment of power realities may be more realistic than clinician’s)
·      idealization or paradoxical gratitude
·      sense of special or supernatural relationship
·      acceptance of belief system or rationalizations of perpetrator
 
6. Alterations in relations with others, including
·      isolation and withdrawal
·      disruption of intimate relationships
·      repeated search for rescuer (may alternate with isolation and withdrawal)
·      persistent distrust
·      repeated failures of self-protection
 
7. Alterations in systems of meaning
·      loss of sustaining faith
·      sense of hopelessness and despair

--------------------------

episodes.title: belief and fervor, part two
episodes.description:
An understanding of fervour is lacking in most assessments of membership in authoritarian cults. Yuval Laor, PhD’s, breakthrough work leads to a deeper understanding of involvement with abusive groups and individuals. Yuval continues his examination of awe, fervour and belief. The conditions of mania and temporal lobe epilepsy show how the brain functions and possible aspects of fervour. Yuval asserts that some cult leaders show signs of temporal lobe epilepsy. He discusses the importance of the vestibular system, which affects balance during awe experiences, giving feelings of floating. At the heart of this new understanding are ‘feelings of knowing’ – how we become certain of beliefs without real evidence.

episodes.title: Bonnie Woods’ experiences in and out of Scientology
episodes.description:
Bonnie and Jon have been close friends since 1991. Bonnie left Scientology after taking all of the available “upper levels” and training to Class IV. She had directed Scientology Apple Schools and been Director of Processing at the American Saint Hill Organization. Bonnie and her husband Richard worked closely with Jon in the early 1990s before setting up Escape to help former members. 

Bonnie and Richard endured seven years of litigation for handing out the leaflet “What the Scientologists don’t tell you”. For a revised version, see this link: https://www.facebook.com/notes/jon-atack/what-the-scientologists-dont-tell-you-a-pamphlet-by-bonnie-woods/904278513351578/

This leaflet proved effective in closing down both the East Grinstead Dianetic Book Shop and the Chichester Scientology Mission, when street recruiters were tagged by local Christians who handed the leaflet to everyone approached by the recruiter. Eventually, the Scientologists withdrew their case, apologized in in the London High Court, paid £55,000 in damages, the costs of the action and made an undertaking that Richard and Bonnie can say whatever they like based upon the voluminous documents used in court discovery.
 
link: http://www.escapeint.org/legal/apology.htm

episodes.title: "just wake up fifteen minutes earlier" - paper sculpture by Sam Atack
episodes.description:
Sam explains his inspiration for this intricate paper sculpture. He was misdiagnosed with chronic fatigue syndrom/ME and the treatment made his life a misery for several years. Finally, almost three years ago he moved his clock to a delayed sleep-wake phase - sleeping eight hours, but waking after noon - and the many and overwhelming symptoms accredited to chronic fatigue syndrome/ME turned out to be sleep deprivation and faded within weeks. Delayed sleep-wake phase affects as many as 25% of people - many also have advanced wake-phase - and goes almost unnoticed in the medical world, where many adolescents are probably misdiagnosed as Sam was, and in the UK schools 'learning centres' are packed with drowsy children whose education is being wrecked - along with their health and their confidence.

episodes.title: reclaiming skills learned in an extreme authoritarian sect - with Christian Szurko
episodes.description:
For more than four decades, Christian Szurko has been aiding the recovery of former members of extreme authoritarian groups. Christian and Jon talk about reclaiming - or "recycling" - skills learned in a group. Some groups reduce members to almost child-like dependence, and those members, once out, need to overcome shame and recover self-esteem on the path to independence and re-socialization. Some former members feel like imposters, and may need to learn how to assert themselves and express their doubts and concerns. Learning how to play is often an important part of developing a new self.

To contribute to Christian's work at the Dialogue Centre: https://dialogcentre.org.uk/how-you-can-help/

episodes.title: voodoo child (slight return) – a novel
episodes.description:
Jon reads from his novel, voodoo child (slight return) and answers Sam’s qeustions. 

A gothic thriller about the Jimi Hendrix and his Cherokee heritage, the blues, the real voodoo, and a devious cult group, Voodoo Child (slight return) is a celebration of the lyrical themes of the hippie era: a discussion of the eternal now, the genius in everyone, and that in our lives, we are always at the crossroads.

From the Amazon synopsis:
The first accurate account of the sad death of Jimi Hendrix, set in a fantasy novel. 

Reclusive ad man Big is jarred out of an Ecstasy trip by the now mature Jimi Hendrix. The charismatic rock star propels Big into a cult group, where members believe themselves to be members of the lost Cherokee Kanasta tribe. Their new leader, former dominatrix Wasp Tongue, reclaims the magical Ulunsuti crystal, and sets about revenging the Cherokee on the White world.

Big teams up with Peter, a brilliant fifteen-year-old musician who has grown up in the cult and longs to escape it. Big also falls head over heels in love with Beloved Woman, the daughter of the cult’s recently demised founder, Wide Eye.

Big tumbles through a series of dreams and visions, discovering strange facets of Jimi Hendrix’s life, fragments of Cherokee lore, and bits of Blues legend. Ultimately, this journey leads to the resolution of his own retreat from life and relationships.

___________________________________________

Why does it take most people such a long time to recover from involvement in an authoritarian group? Chris talks about his own recovery as a born-in Scientologist. Chris and Jon discuss Judith Herman's description of complex post traumatic stress disorder which is relevant to anyone who has been involved in an authoritarian group or relationship.

NOTE: Please excuse the occasional crackle and glitch. Bandwidth was affected by massive Internet use.

episodes.title: relaxation rather than Mindfulness
episodes.description:
Is there scientific evidence for the benefits of Mindfulness? Can Mindfulness be dangerous for some people? Why have the National Institutes for Health spent $100 million on research and have they proved any benefit? Why has the UK National Health Service adopted Mindfulness? Why have the US military committed $31 million to Mindfulness practice?

Jon says that Professor Mark Williams, who is mentioned in the talk, is the former director of the Oxford Mindfulness Centre.

This NHS article has a breathing exercise for stress reduction: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/stress-anxiety-depression/ways-relieve-stress/

Professor Willoughby Britton has designed a meditation safety and trauma-informed mindfulness training called First Do No Harm:https://www.brown.edu/research/labs/britton/news/2018/02/first-do-no-harm-meditation-safety-training-2018-2019-schedule 

She has also co-authored a the valuable paper The Varieties of Contemplative Experience: https://www.brown.edu/research/labs/britton/research/varieties-contemplative-experience

Jon's published books are available here: https://www.amazon.com/Jon-Atack/e/B000AQ53YC? and wherever fine books are sold

episodes.title: reflections on Triratna
episodes.description:
The UK's Attorney general is a member of Triratna; are Mindfulness promoters Breathworks also part of this group? Do safeguarding procedures work in Triratna? Is Buddhism misogynistic? Should ordained monks have sex? What happens when members report abuse? Is infatuation with a guru dangerous?

Michelle wishes to make the correction: her housemates were order members in training, not fully ordained yet.

episodes.title: jon visits "on belief" with Karen Geier
episodes.description:
jon visits with Karen Geier on her podcast, "On Belief." we are re-posting it here with her kind permission. 

Karen and jon discuss his time in Scientology, his work researching that cult with journalist Russell Miller, and his years of helping others unravel the cult's indoctrination, before moving on to the subject of cults and authoritarianism in general - and as usual, touching on many many other fascinating topics besides.

NOTE: Jon would like to thank Alicia Montero for correcting his mistaken notion that South-East Asian Buddhists belong to the Mahayana tradition, as she says, they belong to the earlier Theravadim.

to check out more of Karen's podcasts, visit: http://onbelief.com

to rent videos of the in-depth lectures on Scientology from the 'Getting Clear' conference of June 2015 in Toronto: https://vimeo.com/ondemand/gettingclear

for a copy of jon's book, Scientology: Cult of Greed (to buy or borrow free with Kindle Unlimited): https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/150549012X/

to explore Sir Kenneth Robinson's suggested education reforms: http://sirkenrobinson.com

for more on Ira Chaleff's work on Intelligent Disobedience: https://irachaleff.com

to watch the video on 6 of Cialdini's 7 laws of persuasion: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cFdCzN7RYbw

(N.B. - since the source material was published, Cialdini has updated his laws, splitting  'Liking' into 'Liking' and 'Unity')

for a copy of Jon's book, Opening Minds: https://www.amazon.com/opening-minds-manipulation-influence-brainwashing-ebook/dp/B01LYWEPJV/

SPIKE'S NITPICKY COMMENTS: In fact, the husband did NOT lower the lights deliberately - in the play and the movie adaptations, the raising and lowering of the lights was an incidental result of the husband’s presence in the upper rooms, quite apart from his other, deliberate maneuvers to confound her senses (gaslights were run on a pressurized line, meaning that raising the lights in one section of the house would automatically lower the lights in all the other rooms). Although the 1944 film with Ingrid Bergman and Charles Boyer is the best-known, I prefer the 1940 version with Diana Wynard and Anton Walbrook, simply because Walbrook is much better at being totally evil. However, the 1944 film is also worth a look, if only for Angela Lansbury's first film appearance at age 19 as Nancy, the parlormaid. You can find the 1940 version here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UYmtzaHwCKo - and check out my article on gaslighting, here: https://www.openmindsfoundation.org/gaslighting-how-predators-take-control-by-turning-down-the-lights/

episodes.title: an introduction to Saminanity
episodes.description:
jon and sam talk about the Unification Church of Saminanity, the cult which sam created when he was 14. like many high-control groups, it had a collection of rules which were confusing, contradictory, and arbitrary; unlike any high-control group, it hurt no-one, but gave many people a rather good laugh.
